Class ComputerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
      • ComputerPlayer

  • public class ComputerPlayer
extends Player
    Class used to store fields and methods associated with Computer Players in RACKO, inherits from Player.java Date Created: 2/17/2014 Last Modified: 2/24/2014 Author: Scott Twombly

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int dValue
      current value of discard pile, used in AI decisions
      int TIME
      value used in the wait methods so AI turns don't happen instantly

      • Fields inherited from class Player

        current, currentScore, drawnFromDiscard, drawnFromMain, hasDrawn, id, isAI, isTurn, isWinner, lastMove, name, rack, runningScore, showCards, swaps, tookAction

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComputerPlayer(int playerNum, Deck main, int Time, boolean showCards)
      constructor simply calls super constructor for rack creation and then sets TIME variable, (demoMode has shorter TIME so turns go faster)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getInput(int dValue)
      AI version of getInput (main or discard).
      char getKeepOrNot(Card temp)
      AI version of getKeepOrNot(), determines if the card drawn from the main pile can be used, discards it if not.
      char getSwapInput(Card temp)
      AI version of getSwapInput(), finds the spot on the rack the temp Card (card in hand) needs to go by looking at its value and the boolean flags.
      void resetRackFlags()
      resets the boolean flags representing the various AI slots.
      void timeWait()
      generic wait method to keep AI decisions on screen so player is aware of them

      • Methods inherited from class Player

        emptyRack, fillRack, getCurrentScore, setIsTurn, showHand, wins

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • dValue

        public int dValue
        current value of discard pile, used in AI decisions

      • TIME

        public final int TIME
        value used in the wait methods so AI turns don't happen instantly

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComputerPlayer

        public ComputerPlayer(int playerNum,
              Deck main,
              int Time,
              boolean showCards)
        constructor simply calls super constructor for rack creation and then sets TIME variable, (demoMode has shorter TIME so turns go faster)
        Parameters:
        playerNum - the ID to be assigned to the player
        main - the main deck
        Time - time value for simulating AI "thought"
        showCards - wether or not to show the cards

    • Method Detail

      • timeWait

        public void timeWait()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        generic wait method to keep AI decisions on screen so player is aware of them
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if thread is interrupted

      • getInput

        public char getInput(int dValue)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.InterruptedException
        AI version of getInput (main or discard). uses discard value (dValue) to determine if the current discarded card can be used. Also sets the various boolean flags if the spots in the rack need "filling"
        Specified by:
        getInput in class Player
        Parameters:
        dValue - values of the card currently on top of discard pile
        Returns:
        char choice (AI choice)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getSwapInput

        public char getSwapInput(Card temp)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        AI version of getSwapInput(), finds the spot on the rack the temp Card (card in hand) needs to go by looking at its value and the boolean flags.
        Specified by:
        getSwapInput in class Player
        Parameters:
        temp - current card passed to it, used in decision making
        Returns:
        char choice (ai choice)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

        public char getKeepOrNot(Card temp)

                         java.lang.InterruptedException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        cahr chocie (AI choice)

      • resetRackFlags

        public void resetRackFlags()
        resets the boolean flags representing the various AI slots. is called during a new game setup
        Specified by:
        resetRackFlags in class Player
